topComments.author: Emma

Nosso guia estava nos levando para as rotas mais dif√≠ceis, onde em um ponto que tivemos para ajustar nosso pesco√ßo com uma abertura rock. Se voc√™ tiver tempo e oportunidade, n√£o perca esta!  (Original) The most intense caving experience I‚Äôve ever done. It‚Äôs sad that you cannot bring any cameras or electronic with you on the tour but tour company email you some pictures. I enjoyed the adventure so much! Swimming, crawling, climbing are needed. The difficulty level was measured as 6 out of 10, but our group had two 70+ ladies who made through! topComments.author: Derek
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Eu tenho espeleologia e espeleologia em muitos sistemas de cavernas e esta √© de longe a aventura mais legal. (Original) I've been caving and spelunking in many cave systems and this one is by far the coolest all around adventure. The walk though the jungle, swimming through the mouth of the cave, boulder climbing, and all of the artifacts make this place a real life Indiana Jones situation. You can't take cameras in side which is great. Ypu would spend 2 hours just taking pics and not enjoying the experience. You'd honestly either lose them or ruin them in many of the spots where you have to swim. Easy enough that the 9 year old and 70 year old both killed it yet both had fun.

topComments.author: S Aaron
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Este passeio depende do tamanho. Se voc√™ √© grande ou est√° acima do peso, verifique com a empresa de turismo a possibilidade de passar pela caverna. H√° partes em que voc√™ se espreme apenas com um quadro de 5'10", 165, e uma parte em que seu pesco√ßo passa pela abertura e o resto est√° debaixo d'√°gua. As √∫nicas pessoas nesta turn√™ eram pessoas magras. Esta √© uma caverna rude que discrimina. O passeio em si √© maravilhoso! Voc√™ tem um guia tur√≠stico que o educa ao longo do caminho sobre a caverna, sua forma√ß√£o, c√°lcio, enxofre, carbono e outros ac√∫mulos ao longo dos anos. Os potes, esqueletos e artefatos maias est√£o no final da caverna. A excurs√£o vale a pena. Eu temia esta excurs√£o. Eu temia a √°gua fria e a escalada. A √°gua n√£o √© t√£o fria e a escalada √© dif√≠cil, mas nada muito ruim. Eu recomendo este passeio de caverna! Temi o pior e experimentei o melhor!  (Original) This tour is size dependent. If you are large framed or over weight, check with the tour company about the ability to go through the cave. There are parts where you squeeze through barely with a frame of 5‚Äô10‚Äù, 165, and a part where your neck goes through the opening and the rest of you are under water. The only people on this tour were skinny people. This is a rude cave that it discriminates. The tour itself is wonderful!  You have a tour guide that educates you along the way about the cave, its formation, the calcium, sulfur, carbon and other buildup over the years. The Mayan pots, skeletons, and artifacts are at the end of the cave. The excursion is worth it. I feared this excursion. I feared the cold water, and the rock climbing. The water isn‚Äôt that cold at all and the climbing is rough but nothing too bad. I highly recommend this cave tour! I feared the worst and experienced the best!

topComments.author: Truc Illerhaus
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Definitivamente o destaque de nossa viagem para Belize! Reservamos o tour com Belize Espeleologia Expeditions, e nosso guia (Orlando) foi √≥timo. Eu sou claustrof√≥bico, bastante en√©rgica, mas n√£o um atleta, e n√£o pode nadar. Eu decidi juntar o meu marido e filho como uma atividade familiar, e foi totalmente estressado antes da turn√™. Ele acabou por ser uma experi√™ncia incr√≠vel, e foi entre os mais queridos memor√°veis ‚Äã‚Äãde nossas viagens (e estamos temperado viajantes.) Toda a assist√™ncia foi um bem-worth exerc√≠cio, envolvendo caminhadas atrav√©s da selva para chegar √† entrada da caverna, e andando na √°gua, nata√ß√£o, √†s vezes, e subindo as pedras dentro da caverna. A forma√ß√£o de rocha foi impressionante. E o melhor de tudo era alcan√ßar as c√¢maras finais onde a antiga cer√¢mica maia e esqueletos foram localizados. O passeio terminou com todos os grupos encontro onde come√ßamos para um almo√ßo de Belize. A qualidade dos alimentos foi uma agrad√°vel surpresa. Altamente recomendado!  (Original) Definitely the highlight of our trip to Belize!   We booked the tour with Belize Caving Expeditions, and our guide (Orlando) was just great. I am claustrophobic,  fairly energetic but not an athlete, and can't swim.  I decided to join my husband and son as a family activity, and was totally stressed out before the tour.  It turned out to be an amazing experience, and was amongst the most memorable ones of our travels (and we are seasoned travelers.)    The entire tour was a well-worth exercise, involving hiking through the jungle to get to the cave entrance, and walking in water, swimming at times, and climbing up the boulders inside the cave.      The rock formation was stunning.  And best of all was to reach the final chambers where ancient Mayan pottery and skeletons were located.      The tour ended with all groups meeting up where we started for a Belizean lunch.   The food quality was a nice surprise.   Highly recommended!

topComments.author: Troy Scoggins
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Amei! T√£o interessante. A √°gua tirou o f√¥lego de t√£o fria. Nosso guia Manuel foi fant√°stico. T√™nis √© uma obriga√ß√£o para a caminhada dentro e fora. Os sapatos s√£o usados ‚Äã‚Äãna maior parte do caminho at√© o final. √Ågua √© ombro profundo em algumas √°reas. Um deve fazer se em Belize!  (Original) Loved it! So interesting.  The water took your breath away it was so cold.  Our guide Manuel was fantastic.  Tennis shoes are a must for the hike in and out. Shoes are worn most of the way until the very end.  Water is shoulder deep in some areas.  A must do if in Belize!

topComments.author: Catherine Hunt
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Meu marido e eu fizemos o passeio de caixa eletr√¥nico (Actun Tunichil Muknal) em meados de maio. √â realmente uma aventura e experi√™ncia de aprendizado √∫nica na vida, e eu recomendo faz√™-lo quando voc√™ estiver hospedado na √°rea de San Ignacio. Meu marido e eu somos ativos e aventureiros; no entanto, esta √© uma das atividades mais emocionantes e extenuantes que fizemos. N√≥s fomos com MayaWalk e seu site tem uma boa descri√ß√£o do passeio; no entanto, n√£o captura totalmente a experi√™ncia incr√≠vel e emocionante. Eric, nosso guia tur√≠stico, conhecia muito bem a hist√≥ria, a cultura maia na Am√©rica Central e a geologia. Eric e nosso motorista estiveram conosco durante todo o passeio e foram muito profissionais. Recomendo MayaWalk para este passeio.  (Original) My husband and I did the ATM (Actun Tunichil Muknal) Tour mid-May.  It truly is a once in a lifetime adventure and learning experience, and I highly recommend doing it when you‚Äôre staying in San Ignacio area.  My husband and I are active and adventurous; however, this is one of the most exciting and strenuous activities that we have done.  We went with MayaWalk and their website has good description of the tour; however, it doesn‚Äôt fully capture the full  amazing and exhilarating experience.  Eric, our tour guide, was very knowledgeable about the history, the Mayan Culture in Central America, and the geology.   Eric and our driver were with us throughout the tour and very professional.  Highly recommend MayaWalk for this tour.

topComments.author: Elise Constantin
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Experi√™ncia incr√≠vel! Voc√™ n√£o pode visitar esta caverna sem um guia e n√£o pode trazer nenhuma bolsa ou c√¢mera com voc√™. √â por isso que n√£o h√° milhares de fotos para ver online, mas duvido que as fotos fa√ßam justi√ßa de qualquer maneira. Fiquei feliz por n√£o ter que carregar porque √© preciso toda a sua aten√ß√£o e coordena√ß√£o de todas as m√£os e p√©s para navegar e subir dentro da caverna.  Nosso guia foi √≥timo em oferecer seu conhecimento dos aspectos hist√≥ricos e geol√≥gicos, al√©m de dicas para nos manter seguros enquanto sub√≠amos. Esses caras fazem esse tipo de passeio todos os dias quando fica ocupado, ent√£o eles s√£o realmente muito bons nisso.  Definitivamente, use sapatos de √°gua com al√ßas. Eu usava sand√°lias Keen. Use roupas que possam ficar molhadas e possivelmente sujas. Traga meias para as √°reas onde os sapatos n√£o s√£o permitidos. Fiquei feliz por ter as meias porque as pedras podem ser um pouco dolorosas com os p√©s descal√ßos. Voc√™ estar√° caminhando, nadando e escalando intermitentemente por pelo menos 2 horas. Um capacete com farol √© fornecido pela empresa de turismo e fiquei muito feliz por t√™-lo. Estar sozinho em uma caverna escura seria muito assustador, mas estar em um grupo com um guia muito experiente fez parecer uma coisa divertida e educativa, nada assustadora.  Eu n√£o recomendaria que pessoas maiores tentassem esse passeio porque alguns pontos na caverna s√£o um pouco apertados para se espremer. As √°reas que exigem nata√ß√£o s√£o bem curtas, ent√£o voc√™ n√£o precisa ser um nadador incr√≠vel, MAS se voc√™ √© o tipo de nadador que entra em p√¢nico ou se debate, posso ver que est√° indo muito mal, pois h√° pedras sob a √°gua que voc√™ pode se machucar.  A caverna em si √© linda e √© um s√≠tio arqueol√≥gico t√£o legal! N√≥s amamos isto. N√£o tenho certeza de onde veio a comida que foi fornecida ap√≥s o passeio, mas gostei muito. Arroz e feij√£o com salada de repolho e frango barbecue.  (Original) Amazing experience! You cannot tour this cave without a guide and you cannot bring any bag or camera with you. That is why there aren't thousands of photos to look at online, but I doubt photos would do it justice anyway. I was glad not to have to carry around because it takes your full attention and coordination of all hands and feet to navigate and climb inside the cave.  Our guide was great at offering his knowledge of the historical and geological aspects as well as tips to keep us safe as we climbed on. These guys do this type of tour every single day when it gets busy so they are really quite good at it.  Definitely wear water shoes with grips. I wore Keen sandals. Wear clothes that can get wet and possibly dirty. Bring socks for the areas that shoes are not allowed. I was glad to have the socks because the rocks can be a bit painful on bare feet. You will be hiking, swimming, and climbing intermittently for at least 2 hours. A helmet with a headlamp is provided by the tour company and I was very glad to have that. Being alone in a dark cave would be very scary but being in a group with a very experienced guide made it seem like a fun, educational thing, not scary at all.  I would not recommend any larger people try this tour because some spots in the cave are a little tight to squeeze through. The areas that require swimming are pretty short so you don't have to be an amazing swimmer, BUT if you are the type of swimmer who panics or flails, I could see that going very bad as there are rocks under the water that you can hurt yourself on.  The cave itself is beautiful and it's such a neat archeological site! We loved it. I'm not sure where the food came from that was provided after the tour but I liked it a lot. Rice and beans with coleslaw and barbecue chicken.

topComments.author: Chris Douglas

Muito experiente, e nos trouxe de volta vivos üòÄ Se a hist√≥ria e a parte cultural n√£o bastassem, a caverna tem pedras de fluxo √©pico, colunas e muitas outras forma√ß√µes ativas. A deve ver.  (Original) Amazing experience. Our guide Jam Jam was top notch. Very knowledgeable, and got us back out alive üòÄ  If the history and cultural portion was not enough, the cave has epic flow stones, columns, and many other active formations. A must see.

topComments.author: Jackie Nielsen
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) ATM 101 (j√° que seu tour provavelmente n√£o fornecer√° muitas informa√ß√µes com anteced√™ncia)  Sapatos: eles dir√£o que voc√™ precisa usar sapatos de bico fechado e que voc√™ n√£o vai conseguir com meias d'√°gua. Metade do meu grupo andava muito bem com meias d'√°gua. Usei Tevas e n√£o tive problemas. Flip-flops n√£o s√£o permitidos. A caminhada de 45 minutos at√© as cavernas √© muito f√°cil e plana. Em um ponto da caverna, voc√™ vai tirar os sapatos e andar de meias. Portanto, se voc√™ estiver usando sand√°lias, deve traz√™-las.  Roupas: nas cavernas √© preciso usar bermuda e camiseta. Por isso, n√£o h√° motivo para usar mai√¥. Voc√™ vai se molhar nos primeiros 3 minutos da viagem e ficar dentro e fora d'√°gua o dia todo. Voc√™ deve trazer roupas secas. Eles ficam o tempo todo na van de turismo e s√£o obrigat√≥rios porque os guias n√£o querem que voc√™ molhe a cadeirinha do carro.  √Ågua: como mencionei, voc√™ ficar√° molhado imediatamente. A caminhada de 45 minutos atravessa o rio 3 vezes. O primeiro √© o meio do peito, o segundo, 2 panturrilhas.  Outros itens a trazer: nenhum. Voc√™ n√£o pode trazer telefones, c√¢meras, mochilas, chap√©us ou √≥culos de sol. O que entra √© apenas o que voc√™ est√° vestindo. Eles fornecer√£o √°gua, mas ela deve ser deixada na entrada das cavernas.  Colete salva-vidas: a nata√ß√£o √© muito f√°cil, menos de 10 metros. Voc√™ o atravessa bem no in√≠cio e no final da caverna. Se voc√™ comprar um colete salva-vidas, precisar√° us√°-lo o tempo todo. Eu passaria, a menos que voc√™ REALMENTE n√£o saiba nadar.  Veredicto: √© super legal e muito interessante, d√™ uma olhada!  (Original) ATM 101 (since your tour likely won‚Äôt give you much info in advance)  Shoes: they will tell you you need to wear closed toe shoes and that you won‚Äôt make it in water socks. Half my group walked just fine in water socks. I wore Tevas and had no issues. Flip flops are not allowed. The 45 min walk to the caves is very easy and flat. At one point in the cave, you will take your shoes off and walk in socks. So if you have sandals on you need to bring them.  Clothes: you have to wear shorts and a shirt in the caves. Because of this there is no reason to wear a swimming suit. You will get wet in the first 3 mins of the trip and be in and out of water all day. You must bring a dry set of clothes. These stay in the tour van the whole time and are a must because the guides do not want you getting their car seats wet.  Water: as I mentioned you will be wet immediately. The 45 min walk crosses the river 3 times. The first is mid chest, the second 2 mid calves.  Other items to bring: none. You can not bring in phones, cameras, backpacks, hats or sunglasses. What goes in is only what you‚Äôre wearing. They will provide you with water but it must be left at the entrance of the caves.  Life vest: the swim is very easy, less than 10 yards. You cross it at the very beginning and end of the cave. If you get a life vest you‚Äôll need to wear it the entire time.  I would pass on it unless you REALLY can‚Äôt swim.  Verdict: it‚Äôs super cool and very interesting, check it out!

topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Cuidado para quem n√£o sabe nadar ou √© claustrof√≥bico, √© apertado em alguns lugares e cavernoso em outros. H√° escalada scrambling e muita caminhada. topComments.author: P Holahan
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Um deve fazer.  Informa√ß√µes.  - o n√≠vel da √°gua varia, mas tudo muito seguro. Quando visitamos, n√≥s dois nadamos apenas uma ou duas vezes e depois apenas 15 metros no m√°ximo. - n√£o √© t√£o claustrof√≥bico. H√° alguns lugares apertados no in√≠cio, mas depois disso n√£o h√° grandes problemas. Geralmente h√° muitos grupos para que voc√™ nunca se sinta isolado ou em perigo - o motivo de n√£o haver c√¢meras √© o medo de que elas sejam descartadas. Isso aconteceu antes e cr√¢nios e cer√¢micas foram danificados. - voc√™ van traz √°gua etc na caminhada at√© a entrada da caverna, mas voc√™ deixa seu watee do lado de fora. Uma vez que voc√™ entrar na caverna, voc√™ n√£o deve ter mochila ou pertences. Ambas as m√£os livres para atravessar a caverna. -voc√™ recebe capacete e farol. - a caminhada at√© a caverna √© de cerca de 20 minutos. Demora talvez 1 hora para chegar ao destino dentro da caverna e voc√™ volta mais r√°pido, pois voc√™ n√£o para tanto. - us√°vamos raquetes de √°gua com meias. A maioria das pessoas tinha corredores com meias. Ambos funcionam ok. - voc√™ pode usar shorts esportivos ou togs de nata√ß√£o. Ambos funcionam.  (Original) A must do.  Info.  - the water level varies, but all very safe. When we visited we had two swim just once or twice and then just 15metres at most. - it's not that claustrophobic. There are a few tight places at the start but after that no big iasues. There are usually loads of groups so hou never feel isolated or in any danger - the reason for no cameras is for fear they will be dropped. This happened before and skulls and ceramics were damaged. - you van bring water etc on the walk to thw cave entrance but you leave your watee outside. Once you enter the cave you should have no backpack or belongings. Both hands free to get through the cave. -you are given helmet and headlight. - the walk to the cave is about 20 mins. It takes maybe 1hour to reach the destination inside thr cave and you come back quicker as u don't stop so much. - we wore watershoes with socks. Most people had runners with socks. Both work ok. - u can wear sports shorts or swimming togs. Both work.

topComments.author: Derek Schott
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Cavernas s√£o legais. Cavernas com rios de √°gua quente fluindo atrav√©s deles s√£o mega legais. Belas paisagens que levam a excurs√µes de cavernas no rio de √°gua doce. √ìtima maneira de passar o dia e aprender um pouco sobre a hist√≥ria local de Belize. Recomendo que voc√™ siga o guia real para n√£o se perder nessas redes de cavernas - que podem ser extensas.  (Original) Caves are cool. Caves with warm water rivers flowing through them are mega cool. Beautiful scenery leading to fresh water river cave excursions. Great way to spend the day and learn a little about the local history of Belize. Recommend you go with actual guide so you don't end up getting lost in these cave networks- which can be extensive.

topComments.author: Chief Witz
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) ATM Cave n√£o √© para os fracos de cora√ß√£o, em vez disso, √© um lugar feito apenas para os que est√£o em forma e aventureiros. Antes de se aventurar na caverna, voc√™ deve saber que o lugar √© muito sagrado e contribui com um fator chave para a hist√≥ria de Belize; especialmente para a heran√ßa maia. Observe que nenhum artefato deve ser movido ou tocado e sempre ou√ßa o seu guia. Portanto, N√ÉO S√ÉO PERMITIDAS C√ÇMERAS! Come√ßando a caminhada de meia hora, voc√™ se ver√° cruzando tr√™s rios, apenas um exigir√° que voc√™ nade. Na caverna voc√™ entrar√° em um ambiente extremo feito de escurid√£o e constante caminhada na √°gua. Observe seus passos e nunca se afaste do grupo. Haver√° algumas partes em que voc√™ praticar√° escalada. Fa√ßa um pequeno lanche e √°gua suficiente. A t√≠tulo pessoal, use meias pretas durante todo o passeio. Em suma, voc√™ ter√° um tempo incr√≠vel e com certeza estar√° viajando de volta a um antigo mundo maia. A caverna √© intrigante e quando voc√™ sair, certamente ter√° uma √≥tima hist√≥ria para contar. Tenha um √≥timo tempo l√° fora, pessoal.  (Original) ATM Cave isn't for the faint at heart, instead  it's a place made for only the fit and adventurous. Before venturing off into the cave, you must know that the place is very sacred and it contributes a key factor for Belize's history; especially for the Mayan heritage. Do note that nothing of artifacts should be moved or touched and always listen to your guide. Hence, NO CAMERAS are ALLOWED! Commencing into the half hour hike, you will find yourself crossing 3 rivers, only one will require swimming. At the cave you will enter an extreme environment made of darkness and constant walking in water. Watch your foot steps and never stray away from the group.  There will be a few parts where you will engage in rock climbing. Take a small snack, and sufficient water. On a personal note, use a black socks throughout the tour. All in all, you will have such an amazing time and you will definitely be traveling back in an ancient Maya world. The cave is intriguing and by the time you come out, you will certainly have a great story to tell. Have a terrific time out there folks.

topComments.author: Quentin Bracquart
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Uma experi√™ncia obrigat√≥ria na Am√©rica Central! Nosso guia do PACZ foi √≥timo e toda a experi√™ncia foi memor√°vel!  (Original) A must do experience in Central America! On top of fun spelunking we got to understand more the history of the cave and imagine how mayans would have first discovered it. Our guide from PACZ was great and the whole experience was memorable!

topComments.author: Kristen Seese
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Uma experi√™ncia incr√≠vel, √∫nica na vida e inesquec√≠vel. Se voc√™ √© extremamente claustrof√≥bico, tome cuidado, h√° um ponto estreito que voc√™ ter√° que passar, mas vale a pena !! Voc√™ estar√° nadando em alguns locais que n√£o pode tocar e escalando grandes rochas para alcan√ßar os artefatos. Eu definitivamente usaria t√™nis N√ÉO crocs ou sapatos de √°gua! N√≥s reservamos um passeio com Belize Caving e Edward foi nosso guia. Altamente recomendado! Ele foi excepcional. Demorou, estava pensando em nossa seguran√ßa e foi muito informativo.  (Original) An amazing, once in a lifetime, unforgettable experience. If you are extremely claustrophobic take caution, there is one narrow spot you‚Äôll have to fit through but it‚Äôs so worth it!! You‚Äôll be swimming in some spots that you cannot touch and climbing up big rocks to reach the artifacts. I would definitely wear tennis shoes NOT crocs or water shoes! We booked a tour with Belize Caving and Edward was our guide. Highly recommend! He was exceptional. Took his time, was keeping our safety in mind, and so informative.

topComments.author: Jenny Marsden
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Visitamos em 2009 e ainda falamos sobre caixas eletr√¥nicos. √â uma das experi√™ncias mais incr√≠veis que voc√™ ter√° e eu recomendo. N√£o √© extenuante, no entanto, h√° uma caminhada de 40 minutos pela selva (atravessando tr√™s rios) para chegar √† caverna e, uma vez l√° dentro, existem alguns espa√ßos confinados e alguns grandes degraus para entrar e sair de pedregulhos. Sapatos s√£o uma obriga√ß√£o e eu recomendo at√© sapatos sobre sand√°lias de caminhada, para que voc√™ n√£o escorregue dentro de seus sapatos. Eu sou razoavelmente claustrof√≥bico, ent√£o fiquei bastante estressado, mas eu estava bem, contanto que voc√™ n√£o esteja em p√¢nico com medo de espa√ßos pequenos, ficar√° bem. Voc√™ aprende muito e v√™ coisas que talvez nunca consiga ver em nenhum outro lugar. Vale completamente a pena.  (Original) We visited in 2009 and still talk about ATM. It is one of the most incredible experiences you will have and I thoroughly recommend it. It isn't strenuous at all however there is a 40 min walk through the jungle (crossing three rivers) to get to the cave and then once inside there are some confined spaces and some big steps onto and off boulders. Shoes are a must and I would even recommmend shoes over hiking sandals so you don't slip inside your shoes. I'm reasonably claustrophobic so was pretty stressed but I was fine so as long as you aren't panic level scared of small spaces you will be fine. You learn so much and see things you may not ever be able to see anywhere else. Worth it completely.

topComments.author: Michael J. Dijak
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) ESTEJA PRONTO - √© uma jornada fisicamente INTENSA neste incr√≠vel site. 30 min caminhada na selva (incluindo vadear atrav√©s de 3 rios) e, em seguida, um monte de espa√ßos apertados e mais √°gua na pr√≥pria caverna real. SAPATOS DE √ÅGUA s√£o uma obriga√ß√£o, ou prepare-se para arruinar seus t√™nis. Dentro da caverna √© incr√≠vel. Ao contr√°rio de qualquer coisa que eu j√° vi antes.  (Original) BE READY‚Äîit is a physically INTENSE journey into this amazing site. 30 min jungle walk (including wading through 3 rivers) and then A LOT of tight spaces and more water in the actual cave itself. WATER SHOES are a must, or prepare to ruin your tennis shoes. Inside the cave is INCREDIBLE. Unlike anything I have ever seen before.

topComments.author: Analicia Perez
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Esta √© uma das melhores experi√™ncias da minha vida. Esta caverna √© um lugar sagrado e m√°gico e poder explorar com o melhor guia local (RIP Carlos, o Homem das Cavernas) foi a cereja no topo. Essa foi uma experi√™ncia muito especial para mim e a faria novamente. Isso √© algo que voc√™ definitivamente precisa estar preparado com o equipamento e os sapatos certos. √â uma grande aventura e vale a pena!  (Original) This is one of the best experiences of my life. This cave is such a sacred and magical place and to be able to explore with the best local guide (RIP Carlos the Caveman) was the cherry on top. This was a very special experience for me and would do it again. This is something you definitely have to be prepared for with the right gear and shoes. It's a great adventure and worth it!
